titleStmt.title: Pendleton County Court, Application for Tavern License
CWG9594

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky Pendleton County Court
November Term November 10th 1860
Thos Roland } application for Tavern Licence

This cause comeing on and the evidence being heard it is adjudged & considered by the that a Tavern license be granted unto the said Thos Roland to Keep a Tavern at his house in Knoxville, in this County whereupon he took the oath required by law and together with Harvey Smith his surety and entered into and acknowledged bond to the commonwealth of Kentucky conditioned according to law

A copy
Att T E Moore, clerk

County Court
To } copy T License
Thos Roland
